article.headline: Georgia Southern 74, Wofford 53
article.story: STATESBORO, Ga. -- Julian Allen recorded his third double-double of the month with 14 points and 10 rebounds and Georgia Southern defeated Wofford 74-53 on Thursday night. Georgia Southern (6-10, 4-4 Southern Conference) shot 58.2 percent from the field (32 of 55), its second-highest percentage this season, and held Wofford to 37.7 percent (20 of 53). The Terriers' 53 points and 26 rebounds were the lowest allowed by Georgia Southern this season. It was also the fewest points allowed by the Eagles since a 59-44 win over Elon last February. Wofford (7-8, 3-3) trailed by as many as 11 points in the first half, but cut the margin to 34-32 at halftime. The Terriers drew within 36-35 with 18:19 left, but the Eagles used a 12-0 run to pull away. Noah Dahlman scored 16 points off the bench for Wofford and Tim Johnson added 13 points and six rebounds.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
